intro: Ludwigia subtriflora, commonly known as the slender Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or orange. The plant has opposite, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Ludwigia subtriflora is also cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its attractive appearance.
